title: How long after they became available did it take for home use of DVDs to pass up VHS? - Quora

response.answer_text: .How long after they became available did it take for home use of DVDs to pass up VHS? Compared to mass market adoption of vcr, dvd adoption was relatively quick once the entertainment industry migrated to dvd and the price of optical drives dropped dramatically because of dual purpose (computers and entertainment).  ImageSource: DVD Adoption Timeline: 1956 first professional magnetic tape recorder1958 optical recording invented but not marketed for 20 years1971 first vcr consumer standard set1972 consumer vcr introduced1975 vcr mass market traction1975 competing standards (betamax vs vhs)1978 rental market fuels vcr sales along with longer recording times1980's competing standards for computer data disc; after resolution, entertainment industry migrates to dvd2000 DVD becomes a mass market optical recording medium2002 DVD sales top VHS sales for first time - Silicon Valley Business Journal  Videocassette recorder wiki  DVD wikiAn Elegy for the VCR

A very long time.Consumers and video rental stores had a huge investment in VHS. I paid $4000 (adjusting for inflation) for my VHS recorder and before Blockbuster the average video rental store was individually owned by a person who had his life savings involved. A VHS copy was very bad and a DVD copy was perfect so the movie industry was against it as well.
